result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Michael Froemel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: This judgment is for fines, court costs and restitution that you were ordered to pay through Dept of Corrections - if not paid during probation - or you get revoked  and have not paid in full - you will be required to pay to the Clerk of Courts any unpaid amount plus interest.

miscConds.notes: $243.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
90 days county jail with Huber.


Financial obligations that were previous conditions of probation are reduced to a civil judgment and tax intercept, payable to the Clerk of Court.


Concurrent with: 15CM405

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Revocation order & warrant received and in file. State makes statement/recommendation, Victim rights have been complied with per DA,  Atty Yohnk makes statement/recommendation,  DE makes statement.  
Court sentences- maximum penalty-  90 days county jail on both cases 15CM163 & 15CM405 running concurrent, with Huber- hours and time to be determined by sheriff.  Financial obligations that were previous conditions of probation to be reduced to a civil judgment and tax intercept payable to the Clerk of Court's office.  DE remanded back to custody.

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State plea reached and 15 CM 405 assigned to Judge Yackel.   State recites plea: 15 CM 163 - amend to disorderly conduct /NC plea - 1 yr probation - costs / 15 CM 362 dismiss  / 15 CM 405 - nc plea to count 2 - count 1 dismiss and read-in / 1 yr probation - costs and concurrent to 15 CM 163.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Court grants motion to amend 15 CM 163.   Defendant entered plea of no contest to 15 CM 163 as amended and 15 CM 405 count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty of 15 CM 163 and count 2 in 15 CM 405 and count 1 is dismissed and read-in.  15 CM 362 is dismissed.  State argues sentencing.  Atty yohnk argues sentencing.

COURT:  15 CM 163: Sentence withheld probation 1 year - costs - comply with conditions of DOC and any counseling

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 362.  Atty Yohnk requests another date to include new case that was filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CM 362.  9:28 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Hoffman appears with the defendant for today only.  9:30 AM  Court recalls case.  15 CM 362 - Atty hoffman entered not guilty plea and waived reading.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also 15 CM 163.  Court calls case and recites appearances 9:27 AM.  Defendant wishes to obtain an atty applied for PD and court appointed atty was denied and has recently been laid off will reapply for public defender.  Court continues to address the defendant - to apply to the PD today.  State makes stmt.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court: Judge Yackel recueses himself and explains to DEF the need for Judge reassignment. Bond to continue. Court suggests he reapply for Public Defender as he has another case pending.
Will get notice of next court date.

Defendant Ryan Michael Froemel in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF filed a petition for a court appointed attorney. Court finds he is able to hire his own counsel according to the financial information on this petition.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Absolute Sobriety  No abusive Contact with  Sonya Taylor-
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "  Sonya Taylor " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
